categories.title: Recent Plugin Updates and Integrations in ElizaOS

content.text: Several plugins in ElizaOS have been updated to fix issues and integrate Biome. These include plugin-0x, plugin-3g-generation, plugin-abstract, plugin-agentkit, plugin-akash, and plugin-allora. The updates address various issues, improve typing, and enhance functionality.

A new plugin has been integrated to enhance web search capabilities in ElizaOS. The Perplexica search plugin provides an alternative open-source LLM-based web search service, improving real-time information retrieval for agents.

The GoPlus plugin has been updated to standardize security check identifiers. The change ensures consistency in naming conventions across multiple files, improving code clarity and reducing confusion.

A new Snapshot plugin has been proposed for DAOs, allowing agents to retrieve and summarize governance activities from Snapshot.box. This integration aims to enhance web3 governance insights for ElizaOS agents.
The KAIA plugin has been introduced, enabling Eliza agents to interact with the Kaia Blockchain. The plugin supports EVM-based private keys and KaiaScan API keys for blockchain interactions.

The TON plugin has been expanded to support Ton Connect, batch transfers of TON, Jetton, and NFTs, as well as auction interactions. These updates improve wallet connectivity and transaction capabilities.
The Taiko plugin has been added, allowing Eliza agents to interact with the Taiko blockchain. It supports asset transfers, balance retrieval, and on-chain activity analysis.
The Mina plugin has been introduced, enabling on-demand wallet creation, token transfers, and network data retrieval. The plugin enhances ElizaOS's support for the Mina blockchain.
The Okto plugin has been added, integrating Web3 functionalities such as portfolio management, wallet access, token transfers, and NFT interactions. It also supports Google OAuth authentication.
The MultiversX plugin has been updated to allow the use of herotags instead of addresses for token transfers, improving user experience and accessibility.

categories.title: Recent Discussions and Shared Resources on Twitter

@Behfar_I I still wouldn’t use it for character response generation but it’s very smart for other stuff

Ideas for AI-driven projects include agents with spending limits using Safe, interactive learning environments for agents, simplifying DeFi interactions, analyzing open-source contributions, and exploring AI applications.

Shaw has been developing AI agent frameworks for years, with little attention until now. Tokens play a key role in capturing value and coordinating resources. A case study of Eliza shows its growth from a solo project to over 500 contributors.

AI agents combined with crypto offer unique advantages: global accessibility, intuitive user experiences, progressive automation towards DAOs, and continuous advancements in AI, making it a lasting technology like blockchain or the internet.
In a market filled with low-quality AI bots, a major opportunity lies in developing an AI filter to improve quality and usability.

A new AI sub-agent, 'harambito,' has been introduced. It interacts with users to refine business ideas, generates listing descriptions for the Twas Protocol, and will eventually handle automated tweets about new listings.

categories.title: Recent Fixes and Updates in ElizaOS

content.text: A fix was implemented to prevent the 'Invalid embedding input' issue by adding additional checks before calling the embed method in embeddings.ts. This ensures that empty or null data is not passed to the function, reducing errors.

A bug was reported where '@ai-sdk/provider-utils' does not provide an export named 'delay', causing an error when starting Eliza v0.1.9 patch 1. This issue occurs when merging the patch with custom changes and starting with a character.

A bug was identified where model configuration parameters could not be overridden via the character file. The 'modelConfig' object was always undefined due to its absence in the schema. A fix has been proposed to address this issue.
A fix was made to resolve Docker and type issues. The update addressed new apt requirements for NPMs and ignored new type issues introduced by recent NPM updates.

Updates were made to the Supabase adapter to fix issues with room and memory creation. The schema and seed files were updated to ensure correct data persistence, resolving errors related to missing functions and incorrect timestamps.

categories.title: Recent Updates and Fixes in ElizaOS Repository

content.text: Several updates and improvements have been made to the ElizaOS repository. These include general improvements, documentation fixes, and updates to GitHub Actions workflows.
A fix was made to the Japanese README file (README_JA.md) to correct typos and add missing text for better readability. This update does not require additional documentation changes.

GitHub Actions workflows were updated to improve security and readability. The 'pr.yaml' workflow was updated to use 'actions/checkout@v4' instead of 'v3', and a duplicate word was removed from 'image.yaml' for better clarity.

categories.title: Decentralized Governance and AI Agents in Community Engagement

content.text: Raising funds can support a more bottom-up model of governance, allowing for greater community-driven decision-making.

An AI agent could be designed to self-market by being actively useful and desirable to users. If the agent is linked to a memecoin, it could also serve as a way for the community to engage in competitive interactions.
A proposed AI agent could help detect and report scam agents by tagging support teams and writing community notes.

categories.title: Issues and Fixes Related to Running pnpm in ElizaOS

content.text: A user encountered issues after running 'pnpm start' despite installing all prerequisites and dependencies correctly. They used 'pnpm install --no-frozen-lockfile' and proceeded with 'pnpm build' before running 'pnpm start', which resulted in an error.
A fix was proposed to update the pnpm version during the Docker build process. The previous version (9.4.0) was too low and caused patch errors.
A user attempted to run the system with debug-level logging using 'pnpm start --character="characters/g.character.json" --loglevel debug', but it did not work.

categories.title: Twitter Post Generation Configuration and Formatting Issues

content.text: A new configuration option, ENABLE_TWITTER_POST_GENERATION, has been introduced to allow enabling or disabling automatic tweet generation.
Users have reported formatting errors in Twitter posts and replies, where messages appear in JSON-like structures instead of proper text formatting.
Set a reminder for DAOVOS #4 featuring @pawgDAO and @PRINT3Rxyz.

Curious about @partnersDAO's long-term goals? Check out this clip from DAOVOS #2 made by @_mackinac. Due to high interest in DAOVOS, we will now host three sessions per week. Set a reminder for DAOVOS #4 below.

categories.title: Open Source Contributions and Dependency Management

content.text: A discussion on the potential of open-source tools for measuring impact and tracking software contributions suggests that such tools could scale to replace government programs in the future.

A security update for the Vitest dependency addresses a critical vulnerability (CVE-2025-24964) that allowed remote code execution via cross-site WebSocket hijacking. The update includes fixes to validate WebSocket requests and prevent unauthorized access.
